title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires amendments to Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code, defining the term 'supervisor' and establishing training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on various aspects of supervisory duties. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires training programs for supervisors, including interactive training on prohibited personnel practices and mentoring for new supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including completion requirements and periodic retraining. The Office of Personnel Management will oversee agency compliance through prescribed regulations. Management will prescribe regulations for agency compliance with the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006. The Office of Personnel Management must establish regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The amendments will apply to new supervisors and current employees in supervisory positions. Each supervisor must complete training programs established under the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 within 3 years of the effective date and every 3 years thereafter. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include new management competency standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on these standards, and each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors. Each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors, assess their capacity to meet guidance from the Office of Personnel Management, and implement a supervisor training program. Agencies are required to submit progress reports annually to the Office of Personnel Management. Each agency must submit progress reports to the Office of Personnel Management on the implementation of performance assessment standards for supervisors and supervisor training programs. Amendments are made to the table of sections for chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. Amendments are made to management competency standards and regulations in section 4305 of title 5, United States Code, with a reference to section 4306.
